lead_paragraph: Wesley Whitehouse, a 27-year-old South African ranked 512th in the world, upset the formerly top-ranked Marat Safin, 6-1, 6-4, yesterday in the second round of the RCA Championships in Indianapolis. Whitehouse, who had won only one ATP Tour match before making the event as a qualifier, won 87 percent of his first-serve points in each set. Safin was seeded 16th after making the tournament as a wild card.
